<P ID=PARA14761 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA14761 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTE 10&nbsp;-&nbsp;AGREEMENTS, COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA14762 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA14763 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	401(K) Profit Sharing Plan
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;--&nbsp;LiqTech NA has a 401(k) profit sharing plan and trust covering certain eligible employees. The amount LiqTech NA contributes is discretionary. For the year ending December 31, 2015 and 2014, matching contributions were expensed and totaled $14,610 and $16,743, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA14764 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA14765 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Contingencies --
</B>
	From time to time, we may be involved in litigation relating to claims arising out of our operations in the normal course of business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA14766 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA14767 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On September 9, 2014, Mr. Raffaele Bruno Tronchetti Provera (&#8220;Plaintiff&#8221;), the 60% owner of LiqTech Italy s.r.l. (the &#8220;Venture&#8221;), sued LiqTech International A/S, the 40% owner of the Venture (&#8220;Defendant&#8221;), for an amount of euro 750,000 (approximately $690,000 at December 31, 2015) before the Court of Como, Italy alleging, among other things, that certain products provided by Defendant to the Venture were defective.&nbsp; As of March 18, 2016, the case is in a preliminary stage where the court has appointed an expert in order to verify the quality of the products in order to determine whether there is sufficient evidence to proceed.&nbsp; An evaluation of the outcome will only be possible after the results of the court appointment expert are known.&nbsp;The defendant believes that the claims are without merit and intends to vigorously defend&nbsp;any litigation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA14768 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA14769 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In connection with certain orders, we have to give the customer a working guarantee or a prepayment guarantee or security bond. For that purpose, we have a guarantee line of DKK 473,100 (approximately $69,000 at December 31, 2015) with a bank, subject to certain base limitations. As of December 31, 2015, we&nbsp;had&nbsp;DKK473,100 (approximately $69,000)&nbsp;in working guarantee against the line.&nbsp;At December 31, 2015, the Company had a cash balance of $292,826 that is restricted to secure work issued by the Company that is not part of the above line of credit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA14770 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA14770 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA14771 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA18884 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTE 11&nbsp;-&nbsp;INCOME TAXES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18885 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18886 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company accounts for income taxes in accordance with FASB ASC Topic 740, Accounting for Income Taxes; which requires the Company to provide a net deferred tax asset or liability equal to the expected future tax benefit or expense of temporary reporting differences between book and tax accounting and any available operating loss or tax credit carry forwards. The amount of and ultimate realization of the benefits from the deferred tax assets for income tax purposes is dependent, in part, upon the tax laws in effect, the Company&#8217;s future earnings, and other future events, the effects of which cannot be determined. In accordance with prevailing accounting guidance, the Company is required to recognize and disclose any income tax uncertainties.&nbsp;The guidance provides a two-step approach to recognizing and measuring tax benefits and liabilities when realization of the tax position is uncertain.&nbsp;The first step is to determine whether the tax position meets the more-likely-than-not condition for recognition and the second step is to determine the amount to be recognized based on the cumulative probability that exceeds 50%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Actual results could differ from these estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18887 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18888 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 40PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Current tax planning strategies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	, including our new Business Plan strategy
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	, have management estimating that it is more likely not that the business units will be able to generate pretax profit equal to or in excess of the net operating loss carryforwards.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As of December 31, 2015 the Company had net operating loss carryovers of approximately $8,420,000 for U.S. Federal purposes expiring through 2035; approximately $5,650,000 for Danish tax purposes which do not expire; approximately $112,000 for German tax purposes which do not expire and approximately $116,000 for Singapore tax purposes which do not expire.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18889 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 40PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18890 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As of December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company established a valuation allowance of $228,170 and $118,328 for the tax paying components LiqTech Singapore and LiqTech Germany as management could not determine that it was more than likely not that sufficient income could be generated by these components to realize the resulting net operating loss carry forwards of these components.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;The change in the valuation for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 was $109,842 and $118,328, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18891 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 40PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18892 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company is not relying on the reversal of deferred tax liabilities to realize the deferred tax assets. The same variable used by the Company in evaluating goodwill for impairment were used in assessing the realization of deferred tax assets (See Note 7). Other tax planning strategies include allocating sales orders to the tax paying component with production capacity and geographical proximity, assessing an intercompany management fee to allocate administration cost between revenue generating tax components.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA19308.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK19308 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR19308 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM19308 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-15&nbsp;
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage48"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR19308 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA18893 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18894 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company further considered the following positive and negative evidence:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18895 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18896 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Positive Evidence
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18897 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18898 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	1) The Company acquired LiqTech Systems AS on July 2014. LiqTech Systems designs water treatment system for pool filtration around the silicon carbide manufactured by LiqTech International AS. Synergies realized by the acquisition include accelerating the change of business strategy to manufacture and offer full water treatment systems.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18899 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18900 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	2) During 2015, the Company secured and manufactured water treatment systems in the pool filtration, pre drinking water filters, ground water filtration, oil and gas, marine waste water, and mining industries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18901 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18902 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	3) The Company had profitable 2015 third and fourth quarter results. The Company noted a significant increase in proposed sales pipeline from December 31, 2014 to 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18903 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18904 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	4) The Company executed in June 2015 a Diesel Particular Filtration supplier contract in China.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18905 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18906 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	5) For Danish tax purposes the Company is able to obtain tax refunds for research and development expenditures
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18907 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ID=PARA18908 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Negative Evidence
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18909 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18910 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	1) The Company has noted a longer than anticipated sales cycle from proposals to signing filtration systems order.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18911 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18912 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	2) The Company has a net loss from operations for the year ended December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18913 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18914 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	3) The Company has experienced a decrease in DPF sales.
</FONT>
</P>

	Deferred income tax expense / (benefit) results primarily from the reversal of temporary timing differences between tax and financial statement income.&nbsp;

	The Company files Danish and U.S. federal and&nbsp;Minnesota state income tax returns. LiqTech International AS is generally no longer subject to tax examinations for years prior to 2010 for their Danish tax returns. LiqTech NA is generally no longer subject to tax examinations for years prior to 2012 for U.S. federal and U.S. states tax returns.

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015, Parent had 1,071,000 options outstanding to purchase common stock of Parent at $0.74 to $1.90 per share and Parent had 7,225,575&nbsp;warrants outstanding to purchase common stock of Parent at $1.00 to $4.06 per share, which were not included in the loss per share computation because their effect would be anti-dilutive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15250 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15251 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	For the year ended December 31, 2014, Parent had 1,960,130 options outstanding to purchase common stock of Parent at $1.50 to $3.60 per share and Parent had 7,025,575&nbsp;warrants outstanding to purchase common stock of Parent at $1.50 to $4.06 per share, which were not included in the loss per share computation because their effect would be anti-dilutive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15252 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA15252 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18856.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK18856 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR18856 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM18856 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-17
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage50"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR18856 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA18856.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15253 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA15253 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTE 13 - STOCKHOLDERS&#39; EQUITY
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15254 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15255 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Common Stock --
</B>
	Parent has 100,000,000 authorized shares of common stock, $0.001 par value. As of December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2014, respectively, there were 39,532,035 and 39,404,782 common shares issued and outstanding.
<I>
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15256 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15257 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Voting
</B>
</I>
<B>
	--
</B>
	Holders of Parent common stock are entitled to one vote for each share held of record on each matter submitted to a vote of stockholders, including the election of directors, and do not have any right to cumulate votes in the election of directors.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15258 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15259 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Dividends
</B>
</I>
<B>
	--
</B>
	Subject to the rights and preferences of the holders of any series of preferred stock which may at the time be outstanding, holders of Parent common stock are entitled to receive ratably such dividends as our Board of Directors from time to time may declare out of funds legally available.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15260 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15261 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Liquidation Rights
</B>
</I>
<B>
	--
</B>
	In the event of any liquidation, dissolution or winding-up of affairs of Parent, after payment of all of our debts and liabilities and subject to the rights and preferences of the holders of any outstanding shares of any series of our preferred stock, the holders of Parent common stock will be entitled to share ratably in the distribution of any of our remaining assets.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15262 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15263 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Other Matters
</B>
</I>
<B>
	--
</B>
	Holders of Parent common stock have no conversion, preemptive or other subscription rights, and there are no redemption rights or sinking fund provisions with respect to the common stock. All of the issued and outstanding shares of common stock on the date of this report are validly issued, fully paid and non-assessable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15264 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15265 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Preferred Stock&nbsp;--
</B>
	Our Board of Directors has the authority to issue Parent preferred stock in one or more classes or series and to fix the designations, powers, preferences and rights,&nbsp;the qualifications, limitations or restrictions thereof, including dividend rights, dividend rates, conversion rights, voting rights, terms of redemption, redemption prices, liquidation preferences and the number of shares constituting any class or series, without further vote or action by the stockholders. The issuance of Parent preferred stock may have the effect of delaying, deferring or preventing a change in control of us without further action by the stockholders and may adversely affect the voting and other rights of the holders of common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15266 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15267 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Common Stock Issuance
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15268 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15269 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On August 14, 2015, the Company issued an additional 27,253 shares of restricted stock valued at $20,167 for services provided and to be provided by the board of directors. The Company will recognize the non-cash compensation of the award over the requisite service period, of which 27,253 shares vested on January 1, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15270 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15271 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On April 13, 2015, the Company issued an additional 100,000 shares of restricted stock valued at $75,000 for services provided and to be provided by the board of directors. The Company will recognize the non-cash compensation of the award over the requisite service period, of which 33,333 shares vested on January&nbsp;1, 2016, 33,333 shares will vest on January 1, 2017 and 33,334 shares will vest on January 1, 2018.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15272 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15273 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	During the third quarter 2014, the Company issued 47,500 shares of common stock in connection with the exercise of 47,500 stock options with an exercise price of $1.50 each.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15274 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15275 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On the July 29, 2014, the Company, through its subsidiary, LiqTech Int. DK, completed the acquisition of all of the issued and outstanding capital stock (the &#8220;Shares&#8221;) of LiqTech Systems and as part of the consideration for the LiqTech Systems Shares, the Company issued 4,044,782 of Parent&#8217;s common shares.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15276 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15277 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On July 28, 2014, Parent completed a registered public offering of its common stock.&nbsp;As part of the closing, Parent issued 8,000,000 shares of common stock at a per share price of $1.50 and generated net proceeds of $10,736,278 net of offering costs of $1,263,722.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15278 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15279 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	During 2014, the Company issued an additional 100,000 shares of restricted stock valued at $158,000 for services provided by the board of directors. The Company will recognize the non-cash compensation of the award over the requisite service period, of which 33,333 shares vested on December 31, 2014, 33,333 shares will vest on December 31, 2015 and 33,334 shares will vest on December 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15280 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	During 2013, the Company issued an additional 300,000 shares of restricted stock valued at $960,000 for services provided and to be provided by the Board of Directors. The Company will recognize the non-cash compensation of the award over the requisite service period, of which 133,333 shares vested on January 1, 2014, 133,333 shares vested on January 1, 2015 and 33,334 shares vested on January 1, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15282 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">

</FONT>

<P ID=PARA15485 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 17.6PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15486 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	At December 31, 2015, the Company had 133,333 non-vested warrants. We have recorded non-cash compensation expense&nbsp;of $10,286 for the year ended December 31, 2015 related to the warrants issued.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15487 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15488 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The exercise price of the warrants and the number of shares underlying the warrants are subject to adjustment for stock dividends, subdivisions of the outstanding shares of common stock and combinations of the outstanding shares of common stock. For so long as the warrants remain outstanding, we are required to keep reserved from our authorized and unissued shares of common stock a sufficient number of shares to provide for the issuance of the shares underlying the warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15489 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15490 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On June 4, 2015, the Company issued to Wolfe Axelrod Weinberger Associates, LLC a warrant to purchase 200,000 shares at an exercise price of $1.00 per share. The warrants are exercisable 1/3 upon issuance, 1/3 on June 4, 2016 and 1/3 on June 2017 and will remain exercisable until December 31, 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15491 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15492 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On July 28, 2014, the Company issued to the Underwriter in our public offering, for a price of $50, a warrant to purchase 400,000 shares at an exercise price of $1.65 per share. The warrants are immediately exercisable and will remain exercisable for five years from date of issuance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15493 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15494 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Stock Options
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15495 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15496 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In August 2011, Parent&#8217;s Board of Directors adopted a Stock Option Plan (the &#8220;Plan&#8221;). Under the terms and conditions of the Plan, the Board of Directors is empowered to grant stock options to employees, officers, and directors of the Company.&nbsp;At December 31, 2015, 1,071,000 options were granted and outstanding under the Plan.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15497 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15498 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company recognizes compensation costs for stock option awards to employees based on their grant-date fair value. The value of each stock option is estimated on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model. The weighted-average assumptions used to estimate the fair values of the stock options granted using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15499 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD ID=TBL15714.FINROW.10.TRAIL.6 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; PADDING-BOTTOM: 3PX; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" NOWRAP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15902 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	At December 31, 2015, the Company had 630,333 non-vested options with a weighted average exercise price of $0.94 and with a weighted average grant date fair value of $0.49, resulting in unrecognized compensation expense of $259,254, which is expected to be expensed over a weighted-average period of 3.97 years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15903 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA15904 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 50.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The total intrinsic value of options at December 31, 2015 was $140,750.&nbsp;Intrinsic value is measured using the fair market value at the date of exercise (for shares exercised) or at December 31, 2015 (for outstanding options), less the applicable exercise price.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD ID=TBL16029.FINROW.6.TRAIL.3 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; PADDING-BOTTOM: 3PX; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" NOWRAP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<P ID=PARA16030 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;

<P ID=PARA16030 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16031 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA16031 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTE 15 &#8211; ACQUISITION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16032 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16033 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 42.9PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Acquisition
</B>
	- On the July 29, 2014, the Company, through its subsidiary, LiqTech Int. DK, completed the acquisition of all of the issued and outstanding capital stock (the &#8220;Provital Shares&#8221;) of Provital Solutions A/S, a Danish company (&#8220;Provital&#8221;) from Masu A/S, a Danish company (&#8220;MASU&#8221;). In consideration for the Provital Shares, MASU received cash consideration in the sum of DKK 12,600,000, that is, approximately USD$2,300,000, and 4,044,782 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock (the &#8220;Payment Shares&#8221;). One-third (1/3) of the Payment Shares shall be subject to a lock-up period of six (6) months. The remaining two-thirds (2/3) of the Payment Shares shall be held in escrow and one-third of the Payment Shares will be released from escrow contingent upon Provital, for the year ending December 31, 2014, achieving (i) gross revenues of not less than DKK 65,000,000 and EBITDA of DKK 6,500,000, or (ii) EBITDA of not less than DKK 10,000,000 and gross revenues of not less than DKK 50,000,000. Another one-third (1/3) of the Payment Shares will be released from escrow contingent upon Provital, for the year ending December 31, 2015, achieving (i) gross revenues of not less than DKK 120,000,000 and EBITDA of DKK 12,000,000, or (ii) EBITDA of not less than DKK 16,000,000 and gross revenues of not less than DKK 80,000,000. &nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16034 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16035 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 42.9PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The purchase agreement includes &#8220;catch up&#8221; provisions that provide that the Payment Shares placed in escrow will be released from escrow if Provital (1) for the years ending December 31, 2014 and December 31, 2015, achieves accumulated gross revenues (i) exceeding DKK 185,000,000 and EBITDA of DKK 18,500,000, or (ii) EBITDA of not less than DKK 26,000,000 and gross revenues of not less than DKK 130,000,000 or (2) for the year ending December 31, 2016, achieves gross revenues exceeding DKK 105,000,000 and EBITDA of not less than DKK 21,000,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16036 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 42.9PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16037 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Current fair value of the consideration transferred to acquire LiqTech Systems A/S:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16038 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 42.9PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P ID=PARA16055 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16056 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Total consideration transferred was allocated to tangible and identifiable intangible assets acquired and liabilities assumed based on their fair values at the acquisition date as set forth below. The Company believes that the acquisition of LiqTech Systems A/S facilitates the Company&#8217;s entry into the waters filtration systems industry market, diversifies its product revenue and enhances its strength in providing whole system offerings. These factors contributed to consideration transferred in excess of the fair value of LiqTech Systems net tangible and intangible assets acquired, resulting in the Company recording goodwill in connection with the transaction. Management estimated the fair values of tangible and intangible asset and liabilities in accordance with the applicable accounting guidance for business combinations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16057 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<I>
<B>
	Goodwill
</B>

</FONT>

<P ID=PARA16158 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P ID=PARA16159 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The $9,383,593 of goodwill represents the excess of consideration transferred over the fair value of assets acquired and liabilities assumed and is attributable to the benefits expected from combining the Company&#8217;s operations with LiqTech Systems AS.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P ID=PARA16169 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Item 9A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Controls and Procedures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16170 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16171 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16172 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16173 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our management, with the participation of both of our chief executive officer and chief financial officer, carried out an evaluation of the effectiveness of our &#8220;disclosure controls and procedures&#8221; (as defined in the Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15-d-15(e)) as of the end of the period covered by this report (the &#8220;Evaluation Date&#8221;).&nbsp;Based upon that evaluation, both our chief executive officer and chief financial officer concluded that as of the Evaluation Date, our disclosure controls and procedures are effective to ensure that information required to be disclosed by us in the reports that we file or submit under the Exchange Act (i) is recorded, processed, summarized and reported, within the time periods specified in the SEC&#8217;s rules and forms and (ii) is accumulated and communicated to our management, including our chief executive officer and our chief financial officer, as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16174 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16175 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16176 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16177 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	There were no changes in our internal controls over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by this report that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16178 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18861.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK18861 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR18861 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM18861 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	30
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR18861 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA18861.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16179 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Management&#8217;s Report on International Control Over Financial Reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16180 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16181 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Management of the Company is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting as defined in Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f) under the Exchange Act. The Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting is designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. The Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16182 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE ID=TBL16186 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 2%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA16183 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 4%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA16184 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 94%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA16185 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the Company;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ID=PARA16187 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE ID=TBL16191 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 2%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA16188 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 4%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA16189 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 94%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA16190 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the Company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the Company; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ID=PARA16192 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE ID=TBL16196 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 2%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA16193 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 4%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA16194 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 94%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA16195 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use or disposition of the Company&#8217;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ID=PARA16197 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16198 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Because of inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Therefore, even internal controls determined to be effective can provide only reasonable assurance with respect to financial statement preparation and presentation. The effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting is subject to various inherent limitations, including cost limitations, judgments used in decision making, assumptions about the likelihood of future events, the possibility of human error, and the risk of fraud. The projection of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods is subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with policies may deteriorate. Because of these limitations, there can be no assurance that any system of internal control over financial reporting will be successful in preventing all errors or fraud or in making all material information known in a timely manner to the appropriate levels of management.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16199 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16200 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Management assessed the effectiveness of the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2015. In making this assessment, management used the criteria set forth by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) in Internal Control
<B>
	-
</B>
	Integrated Framework.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16201 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16202 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Based on its assessment and those criteria, our principal executive officer and principal financial officer concluded that the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2015 was effective.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16203 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16204 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	This annual report does not include an attestation report of the Company&#8217;s registered public accounting firm regarding internal control over financial reporting. Management&#8217;s report was not subject to attestation by the Company&#8217;s registered public accounting firm pursuant to an exemption by the SEC which permits the Company to provide only management&#8217;s report in this report.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<P ID=PARA16205 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 66%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">

</EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<P ID=PARA16255 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16256 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	According to our bylaws, the number of directors at any one time may not be less than one or more than seven. The maximum number of directors at any one time may be increased by a vote of a majority of the directors then serving.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16257 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16258 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our charter provides for the annual election of directors. At each annual meeting of stockholders, our directors will be elected for a one-year term and serve until their respective successors have been elected and qualified. It is anticipated that the Board of Directors will meet at least quarterly.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16259 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16260 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Executive officers are appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the Board of Directors. A brief biography of each director and executive officer follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16261 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16262 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Aldo Petersen
</B>
	. Aldo Petersen has been Chairman of the Board of LiqTech since August 2011. He has been the Chief Executive Officer of APE Invest A/S, aprivate Danish investment company, since 1996. Until 2006, Mr. Petersen was also the Chief Executive Officer of EuroTrust (formerly known as Telepartner), a former NASDAQ-listed company that he founded in 1986. Prior to EuroTrust, he started and sold one of Denmark&#8217;s first hedge funds, Dansk Fromue Invest. Mr. Petersen wasa major investor in Greentech, a renewable energy company that builds wind farms in Denmark, Germany, Poland and Italy. He is a private investor in wind farms in Germany and France, and was also a major investor in Football Club Copenhagen (listed on the Copenhagen Stock Exchange). Mr. Petersen has a B.A. degree in Economics from Copenhagen Business School.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16263 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18862.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK18862 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR18862 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM18862 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	31
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR18862 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA18862.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16264 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Sune Mathiesen
</B>
	. Mr. Mathiesen was appointed as Chief Executive Officer and a Director of LiqTech International on July 29 2014. Mr. Mathiesen has served as Chief executive officer and as a Director of Masu A/S, a Danish company since February 2013. He has served as CEO and Director of the Board of Provital Solutions A/S since March 2012. Before that he served as Country Manager of Broen Lab Group since August 2010 and before that as Country Manager of GPA Flowsystem since February 2000. Mr. Mathiesen has a solid background in executive management, sales and turn-arounds. Mr. Mathiesen has been working hands-on with technical products within the valves and fittings industry for the past 16 years. He has a degree in commercial science from Via College in Randers, Denmark
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16265 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16266 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Soren Degn
</B>
	. Mr. Degn has served as Chief Financial Officer of LiqTech International, Inc. since August 2011. From 2008 until 2011, he was the Chief Financial Officer of Guava, a publicly listed internet advertising company. From 2007 to 2008, Mr. Degn served as Chief Financial Officer of Advance Renewable Energy Ltd. From 2001 to 2006, he was the Chief Financial Officer of EuroTrust (a NASDAQ/AIM listed company, formerly known as Telepartner). From 1996 to 2001, he was the financial controller at Kampsax (a consulting company). From 1989 to 1996, he worked at KPMG in Denmark. Mr. Degn has a B.A. degree in Business Administration and an M.B.A. from Copenhagen Business School.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16267 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16268 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Paul Burgon
</B>
	. Mr. Burgon has served as a Director of LiqTech since September 2011. Mr. Burgon has led corporate mergers and acquisitions for most of his career, leading and completing over 60 transactions worth over $2 billion. Mr. Burgon has been the Vice President of Business Development for Steel Partners Holdings since 2012. Mr. Burgon was the interim Chief Financial Officer of SWK Holdings Corporation (OTCBB: SWKH) from 2010 to 2012. Mr. Burgon served as a Principal and CFO of NightWatch Capital Advisors, LLC from 2005 to 2012. Mr. Burgon was a Manager and then Director of Corporate Development for Danaher Corporation from 1998 to 2005. Mr. Burgon led corporate development at Fluke Corporation from 1997 to 1998 and worked at Coopers and Lybrand from 1994 to 1997. Mr. Burgon holds a B.S.BA. degree (cum laude) in Finance and International Business and an International Executive M.B.A. degree from the McDonough School of Business at Georgetown University.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16269 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16270 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Mark Vernon.
</B>
	Mr. Vernon has served as a Director of LiqTech International, Inc. since February 26, 2013. Mr. Vernon currently serves as a Director of Senior plc, a UK-based aerospace and industrial engineering business, following his appointment in May 2011. Mr. Vernon has had a distinguished career in the industrial engineering industry, with wide international business experience. In January 2014, Mr. Vernon retired as Chief Executive Officer and Director of Spirax-Sarco Engineering plc (London Stock Exchange: SPX),a designer and supplier of industrial steam systems and peristaltic pumping, after serving on the Spirax Board since 2006. He also served previously as Group Vice-president of Flowserve&#8217;s Flow Control Business Unit, Group Vice-president of Durco International and President of Valtek International. Mr. Vernon earned a BSc degree (magna cum laude) from Weber State University.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16271 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16273 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Michael S. Barish
</B>
	. Mr. Barish was appointed to serve as Director effective as of May 19, 2014. Mr. Barish has over 40 years&#8217; experience in the investment industry, having worked as a security analyst, portfolio manager, and investment advisor. Since 2009, Mr. Barish has actively pursued personal investments in both public and private companies. Furthermore, he has served on the Board of Directors of AeroGrow International Inc. and Zero E Technologies, LLC since 2010. Previously, he served on the Board of Directors of Guaranty National Insurance Company, a publicly held property and casualty company. Mr. Barish co-founded Lazarus Investment Partners LLLP in 2003, a private investment partnership for which he served as portfolio manager until July 2009. In 1973, Mr. Barish founded Cambiar Investors, an investment advisory firm for which he served as President and Chief Investment Officer until 2001. Mr. Barish was a member of the New York Society of Security Analysts and received the designation as Chartered Financial Analyst. He received his BBA in Accounting &amp; Finance from the University of Michigan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16274 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16275 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Dr. Rengarajan Ramesh
</B>
	. Dr. Ramesh was appointed to serve as Director effective as of April 14, 2015. Dr. Ramesh consulted for Wasserstein &amp; Co. in 2009 and joined them as a partner in 2010. He currently serves on the board of RWL Water as well as on the Innovation Business Development Advisory Board for United Technologies Corporation. He is a member of the investment committee for Sustainable Water for Food, at US AID, was a Board member of Imagine H2O, and is the Chairman of its Scientific Advisory Board. Most recently he served on the board of High Pressure Equipment Company a portfolio company of Wasserstein &amp; Co. Mr. Ramesh served as a member of the International Advisory Board to The Ministry of Environment and Water for the Government of Singapore from 2006 to 2009 and on the Executive Board of the National Center for Food Protection and Defense from 2006-2009. From 2003 to 2009, he held several senior management roles at GE Water &amp; Process Technologies, including four years as Chief Technology Officer during which time Dr. Ramesh played a key role in the development and implementation of the strategy that led to the creation of GE&#39;s $2.5 billion global water platform, managing engineering and technology organizations of over 700 engineers and scientists. Prior to serving at GE, Dr. Ramesh worked with A. Schulman Inc., a global, specialty chemicals manufacturer, for over 20 years. Dr. Ramesh received his M.S. and Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering from the University of Akron and was awarded the distinguished alumni award in 2005. Dr. Ramesh has four issued patents.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16276 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16277 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Director Expertise
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16278 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16279 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The following is a brief description of the specific experience and qualifications, attributes or skills of each director that led to the conclusion that such person should serve as a director of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16280 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16281 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Mr. Petersen&#8217;s knowledge regarding our history and operations provides a critical link between management and the Board, enabling the Board to provide its oversight function with the benefit of management&#8217;s perspective of the business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16282 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16283 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Mr. Burgon&#8217;s hands-on experience in public company corporate governance and corporate finance provides the Board with a unique perspective on corporate governance matters and corporate finance matters. Given his financial experience, Mr. Burgon has been determined by our Board to be an Audit Committee Financial Expert.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16284 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA18863.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK18863 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR18863 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM18863 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	32
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR18863 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA18863.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16285 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Mr. Vernon&#8217;s extensive global experience in the industrial engineering industry, particularly in North and South America, provides the Board with valuable insight in the markets the Company serves, as well as proven management and Board expertise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16286 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16287 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Mr. Barish&#8217;s experience in the investment industry, spanning over forty (40) years, includes successes as a security analyst, portfolio manager, investment advisor, public company board member, and founder of investment management firms. Mr. Barish is also a Chartered Financial Analyst. Given such experience and expertise, Mr. Barish provides the Board with a unique perspective on financial matters. Further, the Board has determined that he qualifies as an Audit Committee Financial Expert.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16288 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16289 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Mr. Mathiesen&#8217;s prior experience at leading businesses as the Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of companies in the technical products space distinguish him as an integral part of the Company&#8217;s management team. He is uniquely qualified to provide a perspective on matters involving the continued growth and development of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16290 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16291 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Mr. Ramesh&#8217;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	significant experience in technology, products, industry dynamics and business development in the water industry are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	valuable to the Board as it seeks to implement and maintain growth strategies that will enable the Company to succeed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16292 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16293 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Family Relationships
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16294 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16295 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	None of our Directors or executive officers is related by blood, marriage or adoption.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16296 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16297 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Director Independence
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16298 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16299 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our Board of Directors has determined that Messrs. Burgon, Vernon, Barish and Ramesh are independent as that term is defined in the listing standards of the NYSE. In making these determinations, our Board of Directors has concluded that none of our independent directors has an employment, business, family or other relationship, which, in the opinion of our Board of Directors, would interfere with the exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of a director. Our other director, Mr. Petersen, is not considered independent under these rules because Mr. Petersen has influence as a significant stockholder. Mr. Mathiesen is not considered independent under these rules because Mr. Mathiesen has influence as a significant stockholder and as the Chief Executive Officer of the Company. We expect that our independent directors will meet in executive session (without the participation of executive officers or other non-independent directors) at least two times each year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16300 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 7.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16301 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Director Attendance at Board and Stockholder Meetings
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16302 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16303 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The board of directors met 9 times during 2015 During 2015, each director attended at least 75% of the meetings of the board and the committees upon which he or she serves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16304 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16305 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We do not have a policy regarding director attendance at our annual meetings of stockholders. Directors Aldo Petersen and Sune Mathiesen both attended our annual meeting of stockholders held on October 13, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16306 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<P ID=PARA18864.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">

<P ID=PARA16344 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Audit Committee
</B>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16345 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16346 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 48.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our Audit Committee consists of Paul Burgon (Chair), Mark Vernon and Michael Barish each of whom is an independent director as defined in the NYSE rules and SEC rules. Based upon past employment experience in finance and other business experience requiring accounting knowledge and financial sophistication, our Board of Directors has determined that Mr. Burgon is an &#8220;Audit Committee Financial Expert&#8221; as defined in Item 407(d)(5) of Regulation S-K, and that each member of our Audit Committee is able to read and understand fundamental financial statements. We have implemented a written charter for our Audit Committee that provides that our Audit Committee is responsible for:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA16347 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	&#9679;

	appointing, compensating, retaining, overseeing and terminating our independent auditors and pre-approving all audit and non-audit services permitted to be performed by the independent auditors;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

	Our Compensation Committee consists of Mark Vernon (Chair), Paul Burgon and Michael Barish, each of whom is an independent director as defined in the NYSE rules, a &#8220;non-employee director&#8221; under Rule 16b-3 promulgated under the Exchange Act, and an &#8220;outside director&#8221; for purposes of Section 162(m) of the Code.&nbsp;We have implemented a written charter for our Compensation Committee that provides that our Compensation Committee is responsible for:
